sub_tasks.requirements: Gender Selection: The query must filter for female patients using p.gender = 'F'.
Age Range Selection: The query must calculate patient age at admission and filter for the range 53-63 years.
Condition Inclusion: The cohort must be restricted to patients having a diagnosis of either sepsis or septic shock.
Medical Concept Implementation for Sepsis and Septic Shock
Sepsis Code Selection: Correctly identifies sepsis using ICD-9 code '99591' and ICD-10 code 'A41'.
Septic Shock Code Selection: Correctly identifies septic shock using ICD-9 code '78552' and ICD-10 code 'R65.21'.
Diagnosis Categorization: Uses a CASE statement to correctly prioritize and label patients as 'Septic Shock' over 'Sepsis' if both conditions are present.
Length of Stay Grouping: Correctly calculates LOS in days and categorizes it into '≤7 days' and '>7 days'.
Table Join Logic: Correctly joins admissions, patients, and diagnoses_icd (via a CTE) tables.
Key Matching: Uses subject_id to link patients and admissions, and hadm_id to link admissions and diagnoses.
Grouping Logic: The final result set must be grouped by sepsis severity ('Sepsis' vs 'Septic Shock').
Patient Count (N): Correctly calculates the number of patients in each LOS group (≤7 and >7 days) using COUNTIF.
In-Hospital Mortality Rate (%): Correctly calculates the mortality percentage for each LOS group using SUM(hospital_expire_flag) and COUNTIF, multiplied by 100.
Median Time-to-Death: Correctly calculates the median time-to-death (using LOS as proxy) for non-survivors in each LOS group using APPROX_QUANTILES.
Absolute Mortality Difference: Correctly calculates the absolute difference between the mortality rates of the two LOS groups.
Relative Mortality Difference: Correctly calculates the relative difference in mortality rates between the two LOS groups.
